DaFlowPINN.boundaries package¶

Submodules¶

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.adf module¶

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.adf.circle(r, center=(0, 0), dims=(0, 1), inside=False, order=1, scale=(1, 1), shift=(0, 0), ratio=1)¶

Creates a signed distance function (SDF) for a circle (or ellipse) in arbitrary dimensions.

Parameters:

  • r (float) – Radius of the circle.

  • center (tuple, optional) – Center coordinates of the circle in the selected dimensions. Defaults to (0, 0).

  • dims (tuple, optional) – Indices of the dimensions to use for the circle. Defaults to (0, 1).

  • inside (bool, optional) – If True, the SDF is positive inside the circle; otherwise, negative. Defaults to False.

  • order (int, optional) – Order of the SDF. If 1, returns standard SDF; if 2, returns a smoothed SDF for f’’(0)=1. Defaults to 1.

  • scale (tuple, optional) – Scaling factors for each selected dimension, used for adapting to normalized values. Defaults to (1, 1).

  • shift (tuple, optional) – Shifts for each selected dimension, used for adapting to normalized values. Defaults to (0, 0).

  • ratio (float, optional) – Aspect ratio (r2/r1) for the second dimension, allowing for elliptical shapes or normalization. Defaults to 1.

Returns:

A function f(p) that computes the signed distance from points p to the circle (or ellipse),

with sign determined by the ‘inside’ parameter and normalization applied via scale, shift, and ratio.

Return type:

function

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.adf.line_segment(x0=(0, 0), x1=(1, 1))¶

Returns an approximate distance function (ADF) for a finite line segment in 2D.

Parameters:

  • x0 (tuple) – Start point of the segment (x, y).

  • x1 (tuple) – End point of the segment (x, y).

Returns:

A function f(p) that takes a tensor of points p (shape [N, 2])

and returns the signed distance from each point to the segment.

Return type:

Callable

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.adf.merge_segments(line_segments, smoothness=1)¶

Merges multiple line segment distance functions into a single smooth approximate distance function.

Parameters:

  • line_segments (List[Callable[[torch.Tensor], torch.Tensor]]) – List of distance functions for individual line segments.

  • smoothness (int, optional) – Smoothness parameter controlling the sharpness of the merge. Defaults to 1.

Returns:

A function that computes the merged distance for input points.

Return type:

Callable[[torch.Tensor], torch.Tensor]

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.adf.subtract(f1, f2, order=1)¶

Returns a function representing the subtraction (difference) of two signed distance functions (SDFs). The result is a smooth approximation of the set difference (A B).

Parameters:

  • f1 (Callable[[Tensor], Tensor]) – First SDF function (A).

  • f2 (Callable[[Tensor], Tensor]) – Second SDF function (B).

  • order (int) – Controls the smoothness of the subtraction. Higher values yield sharper transitions.

Return type:

Callable[[Tensor], Tensor]

Returns:

A function that computes the smooth subtraction of f2 from f1 for input tensor p.

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.adf.unite(f1, f2, order=1)¶

Returns a function representing the union (logical OR) of two signed distance functions (SDFs). The result is a smooth approximation of the minimum of the two SDFs.

Parameters:

  • f1 (Callable[[Tensor], Tensor]) – First SDF function.

  • f2 (Callable[[Tensor], Tensor]) – Second SDF function.

  • order (int) – Controls the smoothness of the union. Higher values yield sharper transitions.

Return type:

Callable[[Tensor], Tensor]

Returns:

A function that computes the smooth union of f1 and f2 for input tensor p.

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.adf.wall(dim=0, position=0, direction=1, order=1)¶

Creates a wall boundary function for use in PINN (Physics-Informed Neural Network) boundary conditions.

Parameters:

  • dim (int) – The dimension of the wall normal (default: 0).

  • position (float) – The position of the wall along the specified dimension (default: 0).

  • direction (int) – The direction of the wall normal; should be 1 or -1 (default: 1).

  • order (int) – The order of the wall function. - If 1, returns a linear wall function with f(0)=0 and f’(0)=1. - If 2, returns a smoothed wall function using an exponential term, with f’’(0)=1 (default: 1).

Returns:

A function f(p) that takes a tensor of points p and computes the signed distance value for each point.

Return type:

function

Notes

  • For order=1, the function returns a signed distance from the wall.

  • For order=2, the function returns a smoothed version of the signed distance, useful for differentiability.

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.internal_geometries module¶

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.internal_geometries.halfcylinder_3d(r=0.125, dims=(0, 1), center=(0, 0))¶

Creates a function to check if points are inside a half-cylinder in 3D space. The halfcylinder is oriented in the negative direction of the first dimension.

Parameters:

  • r (float) – Radius of the half-cylinder.

  • dims (tuple) – Indices of the dimensions to use for the half-cylinder. The first index is the negative-direction of the cylinder’s curved side. Dimensions can be 0, 1, or 2.

  • center (tuple) – Center coordinates of the half-cylinder.

Return type:

Callable[[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray], ndarray]

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.surface_samplers module¶

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.surface_samplers.combine(samplers, weights=None)¶

Combines multiple sampler functions into a single sampler function.

Parameters:

  • samplers (List[Callable[[int], np.ndarray]]) – A list of sampler functions.

  • weights (List[float], optional) – A list of weights for each sampler. If None, equal weights are used.

Returns:

A combined sampler function that generates points from all input samplers.

Return type:

Callable[[int], np.ndarray]

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.surface_samplers.duct(lb, ub)¶

Generates a sampler function for a duct surface (excluding the back wall).

Parameters:

  • lb (tuple) – The lower bounds (xmin, ymin, zmin, tmin).

  • ub (tuple) – The upper bounds (xmax, ymax, zmax, tmax).

Returns:

A sampler function that generates a specified number of points on the duct surface.

Return type:

function

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.surface_samplers.empty()¶

Basic example for sampler functions

Return type:

callable

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.surface_samplers.halfcylinder(center, r, h, tmin, tmax)¶

Generates a sampler function for a half-cylinder surface.

Parameters:

  • center (tuple) – The center of the half-cylinder (x, y, z).

  • r (float) – The radius of the half-cylinder.

  • h (float) – The height of the half-cylinder.

  • tmin (float) – The minimum value for the time dimension.

  • tmax (float) – The maximum value for the time dimension.

Returns:

A sampler function that generates a specified numer of points on the half-cylinder surface.

Return type:

function

DaFlowPINN.boundaries.surface_samplers.wall(dim1, dim2, dim1_min, dim1_max, dim2_min, dim2_max, dim3_value, t_min, t_max)¶

Generates a sampler function for a wall surface in a 3D space with a fixed value for one dimension.

Parameters:

  • dim1 (int) – The first dimension index (0, 1, or 2).

  • dim2 (int) – The second dimension index (0, 1, or 2).

  • dim1_min (float) – The minimum value for the first dimension.

  • dim1_max (float) – The maximum value for the first dimension.

  • dim2_min (float) – The minimum value for the second dimension.

  • dim2_max (float) – The maximum value for the second dimension.

  • dim3_value (float) – The fixed value for the third dimension.

  • t_min (float) – The minimum value for the time dimension.

  • t_max (float) – The maximum value for the time dimension.

Returns:

A sampler function that generates a specified number of points on the wall surface.

Return type:

callable
